wpt.name: GC65B5
wpt.desc: America's Favorite Cookies by Phil and Mady, Virtual Cache (2/1)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: America's Favorite Cookies
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: Located in the City of Philadelphia this Vitural Cache will take you to find the Story of America's Favorite Cookies.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
This brand of cookies were first baked and sold in the windows of the Philadelphia Gas and Electric Company on November 11, 1932. THe sale became a annual Philadelphia tradition until 19_ _ when it became a national brand.

This is not an armchair or web cache! This location would not support a traditional cache but please treat it as such. To claim this cache you must email me who sells these cookies and the year it became a national brand. Also you must state where the information was obtained from. Do not post your answers here even if encrypted.

Now that you have found the spot, turn around. The building that takes up a whole city block is the Philadelphia City Hall. At one time the city zoning laws did not let structures be built higher than the statue of William Penn at the top. As you can see a lot has changed.
Kid Friendly Wheelchair Access Dogs Allowed
Available year-round Bicycles permitted on paths Dangerous area - use caution Off-trail Hiking Required Beware of Muggles! Bring a pen or pencil Historic Site
Generated by The Selector
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: Not much of a hint here other than GPS units do funny things in cities. When in doubt look on the north side of city hall. About 60 feet from the corner of Arch Street and North Broad Street on the right side of the street as the traffic flows.

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text: Got this one today while in Philly for business. I've driven past City Hall lots of times; it was neat to walk past it and see what a remarkable building it is.
